title: Leverkusen dominates European Competition
text:
Leverkusen destroys European competition on way to an undefeated season


Code
library(tidyverse)


bundesligagoals <- read_csv("data/xpgoalsbundesliga.csv")

bundesligagoalswide <- bundesligagoals |> 
  group_by(Squad) |> 
  summarise(
    Totalxg = sum(xG),
    Totalgoals = sum(Gls)
  )

longbundesliga <- bundesligagoalswide |> 
  pivot_longer(
    cols=starts_with("Total"), 
    names_to="Type", 
    values_to="goals")


ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=longbundesliga, aes(x=reorder(Squad,goals), weight=goals, fill=Type)) +
  coord_flip() + 
  guides(fill = guide_legend(title = "Legend")) +
   scale_fill_discrete(labels = c("Goals", "Expected Goals")) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("red", "black")) +
  labs(
    y = "Goals",
    x = "Squad",
    title = "Bayer Leverkusen couldn't be stopped in league play",
    subtitle = "The Lions have made the most out of there shot chances",
    caption="Source: www.FBRef.com | By: Noah Nelson") +
   theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank() 
  )









Bayer Leverkusen has been able to convert more goals than what they were expected. This would mean that they were taking shots or given chances that they were not supposed to have and ended up converting on some of them. This also shows that they weren’t just relying on there defense and goalkeeper to win them games but the offense were able to cash in on some extra chances. They had three players score more than ten goals last season which was more than any other team in the Bundesliga.
